DOC.brief_summary: The objective study compare contrast sensitivity , high low contrast visual acuity ( VA ) , glare meter outcome , subject satisfaction three different FDA-approved intraocular lens ( IOLs ) design improve distance , intermediate , near vision follow lens extraction adult least 40 year age .
DOC.brief_title: Three Intraocular Lenses Designed Improve Distance , Intermediate Near Vision Following Lens Extraction
DOC.criteria: Subjects must undergo primary IOL implantation correction aphakia follow continuous curvilinear anterior capsulotomy phacoemulsification cataract extraction . Subjects must require spherical lens power 10.00 diopter ( D ) 33.00 D. Subjects must potential corrected distance visual acuity ( CDVA ) 20/32 good eye . Subjects must stop contact lens wear least two week soft lens wearer three week gas permeable lens wearer prior biometry surgery . At time surgery , subject must intact centered capsulorhexis , intact posterior capsule , zonular rupture . Subjects must â‰¤ 1.25 D preoperative corneal astigmatism eye . Subjects diagnose degenerative visual disorder ( eg , macular degeneration , retinal disorder ) cause potential acuity loss level 20/32 bad . Subjects condition increase risk zonular rupture , pseudoexfoliation syndrome . Subjects active inflammation edema ( swell ) cornea , include limited following : keratitis , keratoconjunctivitis , keratouveitis . Subjects uncontrolled glaucoma . Subjects previous retinal detachment . Subjects visually significant diabetic retinopathy ( proliferative nonproliferative ) reduce potential acuity 20/32 worse . Subjects rubella , bilateral congenital , traumatic , complicate polar cataract . Subjects mark microphthalmos aniridia . Subjects previous corneal surgery . Subjects irregular corneal astigmatism . Subjects amblyopia reduces potential acuity 20/32 worse . Subjects optic atrophy . Subjects iris neovascularization . Subjects clinically significant retinal pigment epithelium/macular change reduce potential acuity 20/32 worse . Subjects chronic use systemic steroid immunosuppressive medication .
